text.text_translated:
Fast fashion is when companies make new clothes very quickly and cheaply. The style changes all the time.

People give clothes they do not want to charity shops. They might not know this is part of a problem with disposable clothes. These are clothes that people throw away quickly. But charity shops cannot sell all these clothes. This is because of fast fashion.

The clothes go out of fashion very fast. Their quality is often very poor. So people do not want to buy them second-hand. You also cannot recycle them.

So, huge quantities of clothes are thrown away. Charities also send clothes they cannot sell to other countries. This causes more economic and environmental problems.

feedback.feedback:
FAIL: Vocabulary Exceeds A2 Standard. The text passed automated checks but failed the qualitative audit due to the inclusion of words above the A2 level. This is a critical error.

- Deviation 1: The word 'quantities' is B2 level. It was used in the sentence: "So, huge quantities of clothes are thrown away." This is unacceptable for an A2 text.

- Deviation 2: The words 'economic' and 'environmental' are B1 level. They were used in the sentence: "This causes more economic and environmental problems." These abstract concepts must be simplified for an A2 audience.

- Suggestion: Replace 'huge quantities of' with 'a lot of' or 'many'.

- Suggestion: Rephrase 'economic and environmental problems'. Use simpler language. Example: 'This causes more problems with money and for nature.'
